instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V without battery
threads.message:
Clean board, boots with charged battery and with battery installed I get 20V but no charge without battery I only get 5V and about 0.285A taken.

No shorts around any of the <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>

All <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> have the same behavior

Already installed know good <CHIP>U2890</CHIP>, UB090, UB700, <CHIP>U3500</CHIP> and all <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> as well as <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> (from a board that gets 20v on all 4 ports)

Restoring T2 goes well but no difference.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V without battery
threads.message:
Did you get the replacement components from 01700 board too?

Did you test with original 96/140W charger?
This board doesn't boot with 87W charger alone.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V without battery
threads.message:
Yes they came from same donor board, in fact I put the chips from the customer board onto the donor board and the donor board got 20V after all the chips got installed back, so the chips are okay.

Yes all my test are with original 96 and or 140W chargers

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V without battery
threads.message: Check <SIGNAL>UPC_I2C_INT_L</SIGNAL> level; compare with good board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V without battery
threads.message: <SIGNAL>UPC_I2C_INT_L</SIGNAL> diode read is same as good board, good board has data and voltage, customer board has none.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V without battery
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V without battery
threads.message: Yes, voltage present on donor board, not present on customer board as stated on my previous message.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V without battery
threads.message:
Some components connected there pulls down the signal.
Any <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> chip can do that, if detects a problem on its area.
